ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5 hours
5 hours
I probably spent about 2 hours per week outside the classroom on this course.
Approximately 5 hours per week.
2 - 4 hours.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: BEST class EVER!! Fascinating topics, fun and insightful assignments, and wonderful discussions.
great topic! I can't think of another class offered at YSPH that would cover the breath of topics covered in this course.
A-
strengths: wide array of disorders are discussedweaknesses: one cannot go too much into detail with an array of topics as broad as thisimprovement: less contect discussed in more detail.
Great course, wouldn't change anything.
Great course. Very applicable for the study of public health.
Topics/readings were so interesting and relevant. I also found the assignments to be very worthwhile and thought-provoking. I looked forward to coming each week!

I thought this was a really great course that covered a lot of interesting topics relevant to mental health care in the United States. I really enjoyed all of the lectures, the content, and the structure of the course. I liked learning about a number of the more prevalent or particularly relevant psychiatric conditions and specific issues within those. The student presentations were a fun, interesting component. I felt like I got a lot out of the class even if I wasn't specifically learning methods or tangible skills. The class exercises were thought provoking and interesting.Classes seemed sometimes like so much information I could barely keep up with it all, but I really wanted to absorb it all. I would suggest making the course 3 hours, so that it could all fit in at a slightly less hectic pace (and I'd happily stay an extra hour to hear it all!). Additionally, I would have liked to learn a little bit more about some psychiatric epidemiology issues in addition to social and cultural factors - a more in dept discussion of mediators and moderators, issues in counting prevalence or incidence of mental health conditions, issues in study design with mental health, issues withworking with vulnerable populations, etc.Overall, though, great course that continued my interest in this field!

excellent class, i learned a lot. it's unfortunate that this is the only class offered at YSPH that focuses on mental health. in light of recent events, this is obviously an important topic and i think a greater emphasis should be placed on it

This is one of the most fulfilling classes that I have taken during any of my higher education. The small class size allows for students to explore their thoughts and ideas with classmates and the professor. The curriculum design is also very well thought out and the lectures are very clear and direct.The class seemed to be heavier on theory and analysis of statistical data, but it also blended in applied methods to help us think critically about situations that we may encounter as public health professionals.

This was a wonderful course! Megan covered a variety of pertinent issues in mental health, and always incorporated interesting class discussion and activities. I enjoyed both of the essay assignments which offered the opportunity to apply concepts covered in class to our personal lives and experiences.

This course provided a broad introduction to many of the societal constructs influencing mental health and pathways that public health can influence them. Group discussions were interesting and individual presentations were a great way to look more in depth at specific issues.

One of the best courses I've taken. The readings are heavy, but the most interesting of all of my classes so far. Class is a great variety of lecture, presentation, activities. Megan is awesome and super supportive.

This is a good course. It covers a broad range of mental health issues, diagnostic criteria, etiology, statistics.The lectures were somewhat too dense and fast moving to really follow and understand everything. They are fact filled and will be good for future reference.I liked the student presentations, because they gave a good look at a variety of topics that you might not otherwise be exposed to.

Megan is quite possibly the best professor I have had at Yale and also the most organized of them all. This class far exceeded my expectations - considering I did not have much background in mental health going into the class. Her major strength is the carefully planned syllabus and lessons - it was clear she put a lot of time into planning the class, and I appreciate that she used various ways to teach, was very interactive with the class, and really valued our thoughts and ideas. There are no weaknesses in this course, Megan Smith did an excellent job!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  I LOVE Megan. She is one of my favorite professors here. She is so sensitive, and really cares about each of her students as individuals. She values what each of us have to say. She makes the course really fun to be in.

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  great instructor. very sensitive to the topic at hand. I never felt that she made light of any of the topics covered or the opinions of any of the authors of the reading material or the opinions of students in class. she created a warm inviting atmosphere in the class so students felt comfortable sharing honest opinion, which made the class very interesting.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  A+

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Strengths: instructor creates warm and welcoming atmosphere, motivates me to participate actively, provides interesting additional material, is able to explain things clearlyweaknesses: time management, poor slides (too loaden)
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Great instructor. She is knowledgable, approachable, and clearly passionate about her work.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Wow! Absolutely terrific. Very knowledgeable, and organized. Has great lesson plans.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan is wonderful! She truly cares about her students, and really wants to make a difference. Excellent teacher and mentor!

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan was the best instructor I've had at Yale so far - she was kind, very prepared, very helpful, sincere, professional, and very interested in her students. Her lectures contained really interesting information and statistics, and they were a nice balance between examples, videos, stories, statistics, and other content. I really liked that she met with each student before their presentation. I sincerely appreciated the chance to talk with her individually, learn a little bit about the field and her work, and that she took the time to learn a little bit about each of us. She was one of the most engaged and caring professors I have had. She had a great way of interacting with students and engaging them.Also, I really really appreciated her feedback on all of our assignments. She provided thoughtful comments and some of the most positive, happy feedback I have gotten from professors - I loved the enthusiasm she conveyed and her supportive and constructive comments on the assignments.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan was fantastic, very personable and a good teacher

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Professor Smith is an excellent professor. She prioritized students and gave them her full attention. Talking with her during office hours felt like she was an advisor as much as a professor. She made students feel important, welcomed, as if they are active contributors to the learning environment.Furthermore, she is extremely knowledgable on psychiatric epidemiology. Her clinical background was invaluable to her ability to either answer questions or bounce questions back to students in a way that allowed us to think critically about the material.Thank you, Professor Smith!

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan was an excellent instructor. She struck a great balance between research and application, providing the class with readings and lectures that described mental health issues from an array of perspectives. Megan was also extremely available outside of class, and provided quick responses to emails, questions, and requests to meet.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan did a great job facilitating discussion, and was always available to help and answer any questions. She did a great job teaching this course.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  See above. Megan is wonderful! I wish she taught more classes!

Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  Megan was a great teacher. She was friendly, and obviously an expert in the field. The teaching could maybe be improved by focusing on a smaller amount of material.Also, although there was a lot of discussion about disparities vs. differences vs. inequities, it might have been good to have more of a conceptual discussion about those ideas.
Instructor: Megan Veenema Smith  See above, Megan Smith is an excellent professor, very well-organized, available at all times for students, and overall taught a stellar class.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: TAKE IT! You will get so much out of this class, both personally and academically. That's what the best classes are about!
great course
Very well taught. Interesting topics
I would strongly recommend this course to fellow students. Mental health is an issue of growing public health significance and this course provides valuable insights on the issue.
Overall, one of the best courses I have taken at YSPH. Course load light enough to allow you to enjoy the material, learn, and cater to personal interest.
This is a great class for anyone in public health. It is important for all health professionals to be educated about mental health issues!

This is a really engaging and interesting course exploring issues in mental health care and mental illness. I would highly recommend this course to any other student, whether or not they are interested in mental health as a career. The content is really interesting even as a discussion into social and cultural influences on health. Also, the professor is wonderful, the assignments are engaging and fairly graded, and the lectures are really interesting.
This is a great class and one that should be required for all health professions and social work students. I hope my future classes at YSPH can be as positive an experience as this class was.

This course provides an excellent overview of mental health issuesfacing the United States. Megan is a wonderful professor who provides interesting lectures, and stimulates many engaging class discussions. A highly recommended course!
I would definitely recommend this course. It is a good overview of different mental health states and how they are influenced by society, and it provides mechanisms for public health action.
Absolutely take this course! My favorite so far by a long shot. Professor Smith is the best!
This was a great course that provides a broad summary of issues in mental health epidemiology. I would recommend it to any student with an interest in this topic.
Take this course,it is one of the best courses available at YSPH and mental health is an extremely pressing issue for public health.
